snippet: The proposal by Eric T. Schneiderman takes aim at tax-exempt organizations that spend heavily on political advertising but have not been required to reveal their contributors.
abstract: New York State Attorney Gen Eric T Schneiderman issues a far-reaching draft regulation that would force broad public disclosure of millions of dollars in loosely regulated spending on elections and ballot measures in New York; proposal takes direct aim at tax-exempt organizations that spend heavily on political advertising but have not been required to reveal the donors behind their spending.
lead_paragraph: The proposal by Eric T. Schneiderman takes aim at tax-exempt organizations that spend heavily on political advertising but have not been required to reveal their contributors.

headline.seo: New York Attorney General Seeks to Expose More Political Donors
headline.main: Attorney General Seeks to Force Disclosure of More Political Donors
